Reviews.Title: “an amazing place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: ella w
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in rome and it was absolutely fantastic! the location of trestavera is perfect, close enough so you can see everything on foot but not to close that it is noisy. the breakfast is very very good including lots of fruit, cheeses, cold meats and pastries. the room is very clean and the bathroom nice and modern. the most important feature of this hotel is the amazing staff. especially the lovely lady from the breakfast room who will take care of your every need. when we come back to rome we will definitely stay at this hotel again. great place and loved every minute of our stay

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Silversurfer61
Reviews.Content: The main plus of the Relais Le Clarisse Hotel in Rome is that it is close to everything. It is in the TRavistere area which is full of good restaurants and bars; it is 5 minute walk for the rivewr and the Vatican, the Sistine Chapel and the Colesseum are all withiung walking distance. The second plus is the friendliness of the staff. It is a happy hotel; the staff get on well and this shows. We met the owner and she did all she could to please us. Couple of minor criticisms. One, the breakfast needs a little variety - I think I shall give cold, hard boiled eggs a miss for a while. Two, there was lack of information about appliances in our room - how to work the air conditioner/ heater, how to use the safe. We wasted quite a bit of time trying to work these out and got a little bit irritable. But, all in all, a good hotel, fair price and close to reverything

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab staff :)”
Reviews.Author: SJAshcroft
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as it was in the area we really wanted to stay in and we liked the look from the pictures. From our arrival, the staff were really friendly, Gloria particularly, and nothing was too much trouble. Rome had had snow for the first time in about 25 years, and the heating in our room in this former convent couldn't cope!! However, this was quickly remedied by Gloria giving us the heater from the reception area, and a brand new radiator being installed the following day. It still needed tweaking but Gloria again parted with her heater! We stayed in a garden room, which was big with a fab shower - the courtyard would be a lovely place to sit on a summer's evening (but not in -5 in Feb!!). Breakfast was also lovely with a wide choice - much wider than other Italian hotels that we've stayed in - and again the staff (Cristina) were lovely too. I'd recommend the hotel, plus the location is really good - 1 min from a tram stop and bus stops which makes getting around really easy, and loads of good trattorie nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a true Italian neighborhood in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mapita
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to find this hotel after much research on TA and Fodors and spent 14 wonderful nights making it our base in Rome which worked out perfectly. You can see from our map that we travel quite a bit and love Italy. This year we wanted to explore Rome with ample time and staying in Trastevere which is this wonderful residential neighborhood was the best choice of all. Le Clarisse is a wonderful hideaway in a bustling city. It is a boutique hotel with thirteen or so rooms and quite lovely. The building is an old convent that has been renovated tastefully and in great detail. It is an oasis once you enter and step into this marvelous patio, quite and peaceful. It is well worth the modest cost and if you want more room rent one of their suites as we did. The owners and staff of Le Clarisse are first rate and the service is superb. The ladies who own the place come every day to tend to "business" and something is always being upgraded, cleaned and changed. Quite impressive. Gloria, Giancarlo, Alexis and Mariana are the main reception/concierge staff and they are the very best. They are knowledgeable, gracious, courteous with an attitude of "whatever you need we will do" at all times. Cristina and the other gal who are in charge of the breakfast are fabulous!!!! The spread is terrific and every day you look forward to going and chatting with them while enjoying a great meal and a variety of cafes. We stayed in one of the suites which was spacious and so comfortable. As I read some of the reviews it was hard for me to relate because we were so comfortable in our room and had ample space. The housekeeping staff is also very good and thorough. This place is boutique hotel offering personalized service which is first rate. If you are looking for something different then do your research and zero in with your choices. We recommend Le Clarisse highly and thank each and everyone of the staff for making our stay in Rome truly magical. David and Maria Singleton Hill, NH

Reviews.Title: “when in rome...”
Reviews.Author: alekha
Reviews.Content: Since I was in Italy on holiday with an intention of experiencing Italian culture, I specifically choose B&B's and not hotels in all but one of the seven places I visited. Le Clarisse was the first stop on my vacation and I must say that I loved the location and the ambiance and would certainly recommend it as a perfect base to explore Rome! The positives: > The room I stayed in - Oleandro, was in the 'new' extension and very clean, neat and quaint. > The continental breakfast was about the best laid out from all the B&Bs I stayed in during my trip and the lady in charge was very kind and helpful. > It was a nice experience to live in a more residential neighbourhood of Rome, which was still just a short distance away from the main sights and even the Vatican - rather than be stuck in the touristy areas around the station. > Public transport - buses and trams to the main sights are close at hand and easy to use. Even my transfer from the airport, which I managed by train and bus, and back to the train station was very easy. > As a single woman traveller, it did not feel unsafe to be living in this area (a couple of harmless tramps were all I did see). > Based on my experience in Italy, the price for the quality of accomodation was within a reasonable range (as my Italian friends also assured me). The not-so-good: > I had a double room for single use and strangely enough the double bed had two different single matresses - one which was very uncomfortable, but I quickly figured it out and shifted to the other side and had a restful sleep. (Unfortunately, I forgot to mention this to the staff but hopefully the problem can be easily solved). > Previous reviews have mentioned that street sounds in the 'new' wing are rather loud at night and I would agree however since I am used to living in an urban setting it was not unmanageable for me. If you are a light sleeper - ear plugs would be required. > The room was extremely comfortable in the summer with an excellent air conditioner but I suspect that the rather rustic door might allow undesirable drafts to enter the room the in the winter. Also: > I did see reviews which complained about the fact that you have to carry a bunch of keys around (to ensure that you can enter the property after hours) but for me this was just part of the experience. > They were unable to facilitate an early check in (and to be fair, did not promise it either) but you can store your luggage and lunch/ brunch at the neighbourhood restaurants/ cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: cspowell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very sparsely furnished and is definately a NO Frills kind of place. My room was very small and cell like. The twin bed was a mattress on a metal frame - the only thing under the mattress was skinny slats of wood. I was afriad to turn over! I left the hotel after taking a nap! Gloria is a very kind person and the breakfast was very good. That is all the positives I have to say!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel - quite but central”
Reviews.Author: IneseJurevica
Reviews.Content: HOTEL, ROOMS - very cosy, well designed rooms in 14th century building. Breakfast room and reception are located in the next building with a very cute garden in the yard with seating area. Very small breakfast room, but super quality food, hot croisants, pastries and fresh cakes, fresh fruit, great selection of salami's and local cheeses. Reception very welcoming and personal. Classic music in the breakfast room compensates for the small size of the premises. AREA - The street is a little away from the noisy Trastevere centre, but next to the main street with lots of public transportation, so it is still pretty dynamic. Each morning next to the hotel and along the main street cheap market place. General feeling around the hotel - quite and peaceful. LOCATION - 7 minutes to central square of Trastevere by foot. Transportation to other touristic sites on the other bank of the river is confusing and not very comfortable. Tram will not get you far away and busses have 3 different stops on the main street, so we chose walking. It is 15 minutes to Campidoglio and Foro Romano, Pantheon might be 20-30 minutes by foot. Nearest subway stop that we used - Colloseo. If you love Trastevere and its ambience, this hotel is a good choice. I have discovered a new very attractive district of Rome - between Piazza Barberini and Quitrinale (embassy district with cosy parks and less tourist crowds), so will stay next time there. Enjoy the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Le Clarisse, Our Preferred Base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: martingv
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Relais Le Clarisse four times now in the last several years and find it the place we like to go back to when we are in Rome. Just having returned from six days at the Relais several weeks ago, Le Clarisse once again provided us with a great, comfortable and convenient base from which to explore Rome and its various neighborhoods. Also, its prices are reasonable for what it offers. I have read some of the critical reviews some people have written recently about Relais Le Clarisse, and can only conclude that those people would have had to pay a lot more in some of Rome's pricier hotels to get what they wanted. Obviously, we agree more with the MANY positive reviews the Relais has gotten since it first opened. What one gets there are rooms that are attractive and comfortable but also spacious compared to other hotels in Rome. More than that, one gets staff hospitality that is consistently warm, attentive and personal. As other people have mentioned and we agree, kudos go to Cristina, who makes breakfast delicious and friendly, and at the front desk Gloria and Giancarlo do everything possible to help you with your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointed... "Executive Suite" is just a large room.”
Reviews.Author: FreddyDeWit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in this B&B situated in the Trastevere area in Rome. The neighborhood has many great restaurants and inviting trattorias, shops and sites. Very easy to access the major sites in Rome, getting tram 8 just in front of the hotel. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great, with thanks to Christina and Vita. Christina’s “doppio espresso” gave us such a boost for the whole day! We stayed in “La vite”, what they call an “Executive suite”. I’m sorry to say, this is NOT an executive suite, it’s even not a suite, it’s a large room with a bathroom. When, in European standards, you talk about “Executive suite”, you associate it with comfort, a bathrobe and slippers, free minibar, a fantastic marble bathroom with lots of amenities … Disappointed, that is how we felt, when we entered the “executive suite”: we didn’t feel that the room and the bathroom were cleaned correctly. The ground was dirty, the Jacuzzi, shower and toilet smelled musty. The Jacuzzi was absolutely dirty and had no stopper. Difficult to regulate the temperature of the shower.The goblets (cups) were dirty and not replaced. By the way: the hotel offers a car service to or from the airport for € 50. The average price is € 40 euro with official taxis. Talking about prices: the “executive suite” price, mentioned in Booking.com was €300 euro, special offer half price. Why do they mention totally different prices on their webpage? At least, when you read the text of the webpage concerning the “executive Suite”, the reality becomes a deception. Let us read: “La vite, our Tuscan style suite is beautifully ornamented with “Cotto” tiled floor, wood and forged iron.” For me, this room is cold, without any sense of decoration. “The soft and relaxing light of the grapevine beautifully enhances the white and cream tonalities of the walls of the room.” Sorry, but there is no light, except artificial light. No windows, just one door. “The entire environment is furnished by fabrics of natural tonalities including its queen-size bed, which is arranged in sheets of fine and delicate cotton.” Sorry, but those sheets were very common and some time-worn. “The bath is roomy and modern and offers the refreshing luxury of a whirlpool tub for two people as well as a comfortable shower.” Sorry, but the whirlpool had to be repaired, as we were complaining. “Included in the bath is our special line of soaps of natural fragrances, towels of soft sponge and a hair dryer.” This makes me laugh!!! Special line of soaps of natural fragrances…. ??? Where did they find that?? Last but not least: when I told the staff that I’ll write a review in Trip Advisor, we got a small bottle a red wine, later a normal bottle of Novello red wine and a box with chocolates AND a 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: sylvain t
Reviews.Content: I rent a room (Mimosa room) for 2 nights in October 2011. The room was extremly small, almost blind, extremly noisy (without mentionning the noise of the minifrdge that I had to shut down). This room was not in the main hotel building but in a building next door. Maybe the 4 rooms in the main building are better but I strongly recommend NOT to book room in the building next door. They are ABSOLUTELY not worth the price I paid for, even so it wad high season. Only positive point: people working are there nice and very ready to assist you. But that is really the only positve. In a nutshell it is one of the worst Price/quality of room I ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and breakfast in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: scoop9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in this wonderful hotel. Would highly recommend it to all those looking to stay in a wonderful neighbourhood in Rome. The neighbourhood was full of great restaurants, shops and sites. Front desk were wonderful, friendly and helpful. Very easy to access all the major sites in Rome. Clean, charming rooms, also provided us with a great breakfast spread. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: LBC1979
Reviews.Content: This was a Fodor's Choice hotel and I'm glad we took their advice. The hotel is off the beaten path from the crazy, touristy part or Rome. However, it is a quick walk across the river or short cab ride to all the big sites. The neighborhood is really nice...great restaurants, good night life, taxi stand about 100 yards towards the river. The staff was excellent. Gloria gave us great recommendations for places to eat and drink. Breakfast was nice. We stayed in "La Rosa" which was very roomy for European standards and had a nice sitting room. They were also really nice about keeping bags for us while we took a short trip to Greece.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem near the center of rome”
Reviews.Author: mononu
Reviews.Content: What a great stay in Rome. On walking distance of the city center and place of tranquility. Great to arrive in this quiet place in such a busy city. Nice to have breakfast on the innercourt when sun is shining.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, lovely courtyard and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Wex
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Rome at Le Clarisse, and loved it. It offers a little oasis of quiet and calm in the middle hectic Trastevere. The location is convenient to everything,our room, (La Rosa) was large, comfortable and clean. Everyone we dealt with there was extraordinarily pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice with one caveat”
Reviews.Author: pangloss356
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and 1 night in the Hassler Rome. The service, food, and bed comfort in the RlC superior room was better than the Hassler'sstandard room, and 1/3 the price.True, the location of the RLC on a dingy side street replete with graffiti doesn't compare to the Spanish steps, but climbing them to the Hassler gets old quickly. The caveat is that you must have your key with you, as they lock up and go home at 10PM. Because of a room change, I had no key, thus my overnight stay at the Hassler. The Manager, Toy,offered to deduct that stay from my bill, so I would have no added expense. This level of service is seldom seen anymore, and thus earns commendation, and I will certainly stay there again on future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in Trastevere but big on guest satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy3145
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Le Clarisse and were awed by the wonderful staff they have working there. They could not do enough to help you, from Maria the manager, to Giancarlo or Gloria in the reception area and the lovely young lady in the breakfast room who always had a smile and after our first day there knew exactly how we like our coffee. . The rooms are clean, nice size and it is located in an area in Trastevere where you can walk to everything. Great restaurants all around, Kathy Z. Florida

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dwilliams184
Reviews.Content: Our reservation at different hotel had been lost, so Le Clarisse managed to fit us in to what seemed a rather full booking. We spent 2 nights in a standard courtyard room. Courtyard is lovely and for the most part little noise from outside gets in. Breakfast is a good basic continental (meats, cheeses, cereal, rolls, fruit, coffee teas). We saw them catering to a lactose intolerant guest with goat's cheeses and milk as well. One night in the executive suite. The showers in the courtyard and executive rooms could use some regrouting as a bit of water gets out, but the rooms as a whole are in good conditions, clean, and the courtyard standard shower was quite luxurious. Then one night in the annex around the corner. These are newly renovated 12th century cloisters. Our room was quiet as it opened on to a courtyard (different, not connected with the hotel). The rooms have AC but are very cool to start with. Clean as with the other rooms. Not as roomy as the courtyard rooms, but beautiful high vaulted ceilings. Well worth the money. Apparently the hotel is putting in a spa downstairs. The hotel's location in Trastavere is convenient as a 30 minute walk to the Vatican or popping across the river to see other Renaissance or Roman sights. Good access to many restaurants. The staff at Le Clarisse was very accommodating and professional. The courtyard rooms have free WiFi. I would be happy to base myself there in any subsequent trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthLondonR
Reviews.Content: We know Rome very well, having stayed there with friends on numerous occasions over the past 15 years. This was the first time we'd had to stay in a Roman hotel, and we landed on our feet here. It is a simple, elegant hotel which is neat and tidy, has nice friendly staff and is in a perfect location. Unlike many hotels so well located, it is quiet as the rooms are at the back in little outbuildings behind the street. If you don't know Rome you may assume that this place is the wrong side of the Tiber, but in fact this is precisely where you should be staying. The centre (which is a 5-10 minute walk or 2 minute tram ride) is a beautiful place crawling with tourists. Trastevere on the other hand still manages to look like the set of a Fellini movie but is safe all night and still has a few shops and restaurants frequented by locals. The price is good too.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down...”
Reviews.Author: microbob
Reviews.Content: We'd read lots of good comments about this hotel before going so we were really excited about staying at the relais le clarisse. When we arrived, the staff were very welcoming, promised to help us find various bus times and gave us some good restaurant tips. However, we were put in the new section of the hotel and were very disappointed. We'd arrived quite early so we had waited for the room to be cleaned so we could get some sleep before visiting the sites of Rome. Unfortunately, the cleaning staff made so much noise so that we had to put cushions over our ears and they even came into the room whilst we were trying to sleep. The new annexe is so noisy and you can hear everything everyone else is doing. One night somebody left the main door open so we could hear all the shouting on the streets and anybody could have just walked into the place. For the money you pay, you expect that the rooms are soundproof not just fabricated walls! We asked various questions to members of staff and we were promised a response later on in the day but that never happened... we never spoke to the same person twice. Other than that, the hotel was clean, the area is perfect and is a great place if you want to find good food and typical Roman narrow streets and buildings. If you book for this hotel, ask if you cannot have a room in the annexe as you won't get any sleep, the rooms are tiny and there is no internet connection - it is definitely not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mutrock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rose room for 14 days in late December 2010/early January 2011 Pros: Friendly, helpful, multilingual staff always ready and willing to provide advice or help out. Although Rome is a great place to visit, the overwhelming onslaught of tourists 365 days a year has jaded many Roman's attitudes toward foreigners. Staying at Relais Le Clarisse where the staff is genuinely happy to have you there makes the Rome experience into a great one. On my last night, one of the staff actually spent the night at the hotel in order to be there when I left for the airport at 5:00 am the next morning. Great car service for transfers in Mercedes to and from airport. Fast, friendly, on time. My flight was significantly delayed and the driver was there. Clean, well maintained, well managed. Good breakfast selection. Great Trastevere location if you like to be pretty close to all the Rome tourist attractions but just far enough removed from the primary tourist scene to make you feel just a little more "Roman". Rome is a walking city. Part of the fun is walking through the neighborhoods to get to your destination. Most tourist attractions are within a 30 minute walk. These include the Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Forum, Pantheon, and great Trastevere area restaurants. Comfortable bed. Reasonable mini bar prices compared to most hotels. Great courtyard. Even though it was winter on the warmer sunny days I was able to comfortably sit next to the olive and lemon trees in the courtyard to enjoy lunch, work on the computer of just sit. Some things that were worth dealing with (for me) in order to enjoy the list of Pros above. I am guessing that 2000 year old sewers and old buildings just don't function quite as well as in my high-rise apartment in Vancouver or suburban home in Connecticut. There was occasional sewer gas back-up from the bathroom. I delt with it by opening the windows and/or keeping the bathroom door closed. A couple of times the breakfast service was not ready as scheduled. Due to the small size (6 rooms and a few apartments) the cleaning staff are not on site all day like you might find in larger hotela. There is a relatively small window for room/cleaning from 9:30 am to about Noon or 1:00 pm at the latest. In my case due to jet lag or schedule I was sometimes in the room or sleeping and missed a few days of cleaning service. One day they assumed I was in the room sleeping (as I had been the previous day) and they made the decision not to wake me to clean the room. It was an understandable trade-off decision between taking the chance of waking me or letting the room go unserviced one more day. They chose not to wake me, although I was not really there. Rome is a noisy city. Old masonary buildings transmit sound well. I am used to noise after living in New York City for a major part of my adult life so the noise level here was not an issue for me but might be for people who expect absolute quiet. Even though the rooms at Le Clarisse are situated around a beautiful courtyard street noises can be heard at night. You could also hear frequent footsteps up an interior stairway that must have been just on the other side of the wall in the adjoining building. The wall in the bathroom between the Rose room and one other room is very thin. Voices travel easily between the two rooms. Keeping the bathroom door shut at night solved that problem for me. The convertible bed was not comfortable. A friend from New York City joined me for 6 nights. We each took three nights on the convertible bed located in the separate entry hall area of the Rose Room. The bed was marginal at best and neither of us had great nights of rest on it. Bottom line: A great place to stay if you want to be just slightly off the "beaten path", are looking for a genuinely friendly experience, and still require a good level of quality, cleanliness, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but . . .”
Reviews.Author: BSCMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say about this hotel is that the staff is superior. They are genuinely friendly and authentically helpful. The hotel is ideally situated in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome, is fairly priced and offers great value to many travelers. All of these things are pluses, but can be minuses, as well. First, location. Trastevere is the hip travelers' current darling and I have to wonder why. It is dirty and every surface is defaced by graffitti. It's full of tourists US college students and many of the restaurants show that with subpar cuisine and high prices. If you're there for art, there are a few nice things to see but hardly a treasure trove. The first few days, we were in such a dash to get out and see all of Rome's many attractions that we didn't really pay attention to it. After a few days, however, the graffitti became exhausting and mind-numbing. Second, value. For the budget traveler, this hotel is great. However, after a few days, we would have preferred a touch of luxury - natural fiber blankets, more stacks of towels (instead of the one set allotted per person per day); evening maid service to make up the beds after our post-museum, pre-dinner naps; and other amenities. If you do choose to stay here (and you won't be sorry, just know what you're getting), insist on staying in the rooms of the main hotel. They have just outfitted an addl. several rooms down the street and they are right above the street, noisy and lacking charm. Every guest's coming and going is publicized to all who are staying in this annex by the loud lock and key system.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: itsubaby
Reviews.Content: Le Clarisse was a great experience. The location is fantastic,,,,especially after 9 P.M. when Trastevere comes to life. The staff was so helpful and friendly that we felt completely at home. The breakfast, served in a charming room off the courtyard, was exceptional and left nothing to be desired. We recommend this hotel very highly. Dr. and Mrs. Antonio Petrilli

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we could have stayed at...wonderful location, staff, and atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: adftravelers
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location was perfect to quickly see major sites like the Colosseum, Trevi fountain, and the Pantheon and still managed to be in a less "touristy" area of Rome. The staff was incredible! They were extremely friendly and helpful. Even more impressive, we accidentally left a white gold necklace in the safe and didn't realize it until after we left. The staff found it and worked with us to get it back to the US in less than a week! We are so grateful to them for their honesty and flexibility! Furthermore, the hotel itself was wonderful. Our room was large, airy, and beautiful. The web pics don't do the courtyard justice. It was lovely and peaceful...our oasis in the city. We bought a bottle of wine and just sat talking under the trees enjoying the night - it was great. When we visit Rome again someday, we are staying there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Like Coming Home.”
Reviews.Author: BeckyAndWarren
Reviews.Content: Relais Le Clarisse is a wonderful, intimate, extremely friendly little hotel in a quirky section of Rome. And it's about to get even better! We arrived in Rome jet-lagged from the all-night flight and a bit intimidated by an unfamiliar city of this size. And we a little worried when our shuttle driver wasn't familiar with the address and had to look it up in his big book of maps -- while he was driving! But once we walked through the door of Relais Le Clarisse, our tensions and misgivings melted away. We were greeted by the bright, cheery smile of the woman at the desk. She assured us that, though we were there quite early, our room would be ready soon. We left our luggage in the tiny lobby and went out to visit the funky section of Rome called Trastevere ("across the Tiber" from the main part of Rome). We made the short walk to see the church of Santa Maria di Trastevere (perhaps the oldest church in Rome), and by the time we got back to the hotel, our room was ready, and we took a short nap in what would quickly become our cozy little home in Rome. Relais Le Clarisse was very small when we stayed there, only five rooms. By September 2010 several more rooms will be added next door, in addition to a more visible and easy-to-find front door. So there will be a room for you, and we recommend you reserve one. Our room was spacious, the bathroom modern and fully equipped. The air conditioner had a hard time keeping up with the August heat, but we were never uncomfortable. And the simple, free wifi came in handy for sending photos to friends back home. But it's the staff that makes Relais Le Clarisse exceptional. Every one of the women (and it was all women, until our last day) was cheerful and helpful and went out of her way to make our stay a happy one. Trastevere proved to be a good home base. It's close enough to the major sites of Rome (just across the river from the Forum) that the intrepid can easily get around on foot. But it's far enough away from the main tourist attractions to be a quiet refuge at the end of the day. And the restaurants (and gelaterias!) in the neighborhood are superb. We stayed three nights at Relais Le Clarisse, then picked up our rental car and toured Tuscany and Umbria for the next ten days. Coming back to our Trastevere retreat on our final night in Italy was like coming home. We were welcomed back like old friends. And a nightgown my wife had left there had been kept safely under the front desk for our return. Rome is an incredible and exhausting city. At the end of each full day, it was nice to come back to our friends and our cozy little home at Relais Le Clarisse.

Reviews.Title: “Requinte, conforto e simpatía”
Reviews.Author: Lauli
Reviews.Content: Ficamos 3 noites neste hotel "miminho" de sonho. A sua dona Argentina é super simpática e nos indicou os "secret" restaurantes locais e os sítios que só os locais conhecem. Os quartos sáo muito espaçosos e o pateo central, o sítio óptimo para passar algum tempinho à noite (eles poem velinhas). Os móveis e a decoração é em tom rústico-romántico. Bem.... Eu adorei!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Splicanin
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this beautiful small oasis in the middle of vibrant Trastevere neighborhood. Hotel arranged for limo from Fiumicino (friendly driver in the business suit waited for us patiently with our names on the board.). At arrival genuinely friendly staff (Gordana) welcomed us in excellent English. Room was spacious enough to comfortably fit 5 of us. Room was impeccably furnished in Mediterranean style with all modern amenities. It opened up in beautiful courtyard with Mediterranean trees and shrubs. The highlight of our stay there was having delicious breakfast in the courtyard. Hotel is very conveniently located in the middle of vibrant Trastevere which is on walking distance from some main Roman attractions. For others attractions (Vatican) that are a bit longer walk we took taxi that did not cost more than 10 euros, but you can take trolley or bus too for only 1 euro. About 40 yards from the hotel is a nice grocery and a little take-out place with delicious pizzas and other Roman specialties. I do not need to mention that some of the best, but at the same time very affordable Roman restaurants are just short (and pleasant) walk away. Just look for places where locals like to hang out and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EuropeTravel2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights while traveling through Rome. We wanted to stay in a more neighborhood instead of near all the sites. Le Clarisse is located in Trastevere which is filled with nightlife, restaurants and bars. It is about a 20-30 minute walk to the sites but it wasnt bad at all- especially in the heat of July! The room (we stayed in La Vita) was very spacious- we fit 4 in there- and very clean. The staff is what makes this hotel a real gem. The front desk staff was attentive and very reliable for information regarding Rome. The cleaning staff was very friendly as well. Breakfast is included in the rate and I would suggest taking full advantage of it- juice, coffee, bread, cereal, yogurt, meats and my favorite cheese! You are able to eat your breakfast instead at a small number of tables or outside in the terrace which is always nice in the morning before spending your day in the crowded streets of Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel and would come stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Everything About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsraeliJeff
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel where they care about the details, outfitting everything, from the rooms, to the bathrooms, to the breakfast, with the very best. Everything was exquisite. We chose the hotel because of its incredibly convenient location--steps from the heart of Trastevere, short blocks to the Jewish ghetto and walking distance to almost everything--and we weren't disappointed. The staff was INCREDIBLY nice, and could not have been nicer or more helpful, spending hours with us on travel arrangements when public transport went on strike during our visit. All of us, including our kids, loved staying in this hotel and we highly recommend everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet oasis, a nice respite from the tourist mobs”
Reviews.Author: Lorigall
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to come back to this charming little hotel after fighting the tourist mobs all day! The staff is lovely, the room is huge and nice, and the neighborhood is filled with great restaurants. Trastevere is a great neighborhood for anyone who wants to get away from all the tourist traps, and Relais Le Clarisse is a find.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: teknozen
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel itself a sweet refuge amidst the hustle and noise of Roma, they also rent out two-bedroom apartments. We rented the Roman Velvet, which is a lovely bohemian but classy flat with all the comforts and located on a very characteristic Trastevere street (the same building as the famous artist Francesco Clemente keeps a flat). We had a car and it was easy to find parking on the Via Della Lungara, with very easy access to central Rome over the Mazzini Bridge. Prices compared favorably with other hotels-- in most cases we would have paid much more for far less elsewhere. Staff is very attentive, and we particularly enjoyed our contact with Toy-- she is the kindest hostess ever, and she is in charge of the apartment rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy B&B in down-to-earth Trastevere neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: londonlover13
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Friendly staff that speaks English well and are helpful. Breakfast consisted of hard-boiled eggs, American coffee, orange juice, cold cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, and toast, served in a cozy breakfast room. Suite itself was huge by European standards - plenty of room in our junior-sized suite. Only complaint was the housekeeping service: never quite felt like the bathroom was cleaned, despite the strip of paper claiming so over the toilet that appeared in the afternoon. The shower and toilet smelled musty and moldy constantly. Shower drain was slow, with at least half an inch of standing water every time. Floors, which were tiled throughout the entire suite, were never swept, and on the second day of our stay someone (not us) dropped a glass on the floor and didn't pick up all the jagged pieces - I stepped on a large chunk walking to the bathroom and found several more next to the bed. If you are finicky about your bathroom being clean, you may want to skip this hotel. Otherwise, the neighborhood is great, and we never had trouble sleeping at night (not noisy, as others have claimed). Don't let the graffiti in the neighborhood put you off - this is really a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming Inn in a fun part of Rome (and it's quiet!)”
Reviews.Author: mbb225
Reviews.Content: We felt totally welcomed at Le Clarisse in what felt like an oasis in the trendy Trastevere area of Rome. It's right in the middle of all the action but it's set in a quiet courtyard. The service was excellent. We stayed in the Le Vite Suite which was spacious beyond anything we've experienced in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jacarandar
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving from the street. A nice courtyard with good sized rooms, clean bathrooms and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a good location. Great value in August although more expensive in other months.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a jr suite and it was large, airy, clean and well laid out. We were on the ground floor with lots of windows. No view to speak of - just the inner courtyard which was fine. Very quiet at night. The bathroom was really large, well lit and beautiful with both a shower and jacuzzi. Lots of hot water. No problem accessing internet. The cold breakfast was a notch or 2 above standard with boiled eggs, good quality breads and breakfast pies, fresh sliced melon and other fruits, great coffee, etc. The breakfast tables were set up inside but you might be able to eat in the inner courtyard - which had tables and chairs and was very nice. The staff at the desk were pleasant and helpful. We liked everything about this hotel including the reasonable price. Although interesting, Trastevere was not our favourite location in Rome. We would recommend the Piazza Navonna area as it is more central and exciting. We stayed here on our last night before flying out of Rome because Trastevere is a little closer to the airport than Piazza Navonna.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais Le Clarisse”
Reviews.Author: RoosterAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel, based on a feature on NBC's Today show. It turned out to be the best choice for us. Small with only 5-6 rooms, and very quiet. Rooms are large and comfortable and staff was friendly. Bathroom shower is huge. The neighborhood of Trastavere has many restaurants and lots of night life, and not as many tourists, so gives you a great idea of real Roman life. Within walking distance (across the river) of most attractions, but we took the bus most of the time which was efficient and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bevjmaddox
Reviews.Content: Relais Le Clarisse was a fabulous, emaculately clean, cozy, welcoming, friendly place to stay! I traveled with 8 other women for a cooking class in Tuscany, and we stayed at the Relais for our first two nights in Rome. I could not have asked for a better place! The staff could not have been more helpful, especially Maurizio, who took such good care of us. He picked us up from the airport, and took us back to the airport at the end of our two weeks, even though we did not stay at the Relais upon our return to Rome for our last night (BIG mistake!). Maurizio even picked us up in the middle of the city one day when our tour had ended and due to complications, we were going to have to take a cab back. He came to our rescue instead. You could not meet a more caring, honest, kind soul than Maurizio! I would highly recommend staying at the Clarisse! Many of the women in our group, upon returning to Rome for our flights home, changed their previous plans and booked a room there for the last night. I wish we had been able to do the same. As for the location, it was perfect as far as we were concerned. It was authentic, and did not have the hordes of tourists blocking the streets. It was an easy walk across the river, to many popular attractions. Rome is so enormous that no matter where you stay, you will not be close to everything! Relais La Clarisse was the place for us! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: TooterBoston
Reviews.Content: We were VERY happy with this intimate hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room (La Vita) was huge and there was a wonderful jaccuzzi in the bathroom. While it was hard to access the internet in our room, doing so in the courtyard was a lovely experience. We loved the neighborhood (Trastavere) for all its energy and restaurants. We had booked for 3 nights, then were going to Florence for 3 nights, returning back to Le Clarisse for our last night. At checkout after the first leg we were told they'd overbooked for our last night but they'd booked us into another hotel in the neighborhood for that one night. I was upset, to put it mildly. Upon our return from Florence, we found the hotel they'd booked us into (which also was quite nice) and discovered a bottle of champagne from the staff at Le Clarisse along with a heartfelt note of apology. So sweet! I'd absolutely go back to Le Clarisse.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Retreat In The City”
Reviews.Author: dennisdr
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have found this beautiful little retreat in the middle of Trastevere. It came highly recommended by the proprietor of the Hotel Santa Maria a few blocks away - true to his word, it was fabulous. The room we had, the Rosa Suite, was small by American standards, but it was plenty of room for two people and was spotlessly maintained. The bed was comfortable and the shower nearly a room unto itself. The desk staff was helpful and friendly, as was Mauritzio, who seemed to show up whenever we needed a ride to or from the airport no matter where we were in Rome (by all means, if you're flying in, arrange for your transfers through the Relais - it's not an easy place to find the first time, and Mauritzio is the epitome of charm.). All the rooms open onto a well-maintained courtyard (a wonderful place to eat breakfast) and the Rosa also has a window onto a second courtyard, which tended to get noisy as people got up and started about their day - and that worked out perfectly for us as that kind of stirring is a much more peaceful wakeup than an alarm clock. Of course, if you don't want that morning wakeup, you can always close the window and turn on the air conditioner (we didn't as the room was just fine in mid-June with the windows open). The hotel is on a quiet (at least by Rome standards) little street a few blocks from the medieval Santa Maria in Trastevere (even if you don't stay in Trastevere, you should visit this church and check out the piazza, especially in the evening when it's the place to be and be seen). There are dozens of very good restaurants within an easy five-minute walk (and while Spirito di Vino might be a seven-minute walk, it would be worth a seven-hour walk - which is about what you'd need to walk off dinner there. It was, by far, the most impressive meal we had in two weeks of eating at some very good restaurants in Rome - including Il Marguta). We had scheduled a week in Trastevere and then a week in a hotel a block from Piazza Navona. While that hotel was more centrally located to many of the things we wanted to see, and it was a comfortable, friendly place, it didn't compare to Relais le Clarisse. I couldn't recommend a place more highly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay in Trastevere Area”
Reviews.Author: TravelFiend-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the La Rosa Suite for 4 nights and we would definitely stay here again!!! This hotel only has 4 or 5 suites so the service is first class and personal. We felt like one of the family. The staff did everything thing they could for us, booked tickets for the Borghese Gallery, gave us directions and suggested restaurants. The La Rosa Suite was great! The only thing we wished for was more TV channels, but that was no big deal, since we only turned it on while we were getting ready in the morning. The room is modern, plasma tv and great shower, which we really enjoyed since our villa in tuscany had very poor water pressure. The bed- very comfortable, and the area is quiet for a good nights rest. There is also a single fold out bed available in the room if traveling with a child or 3rd person. The breakfast is simple, but enough to get you out the door, they only served american cofffe though, so we got an espresso around the corner. The location is great, Trastevere is very lively with younger people, less tourist mayhem at night, and is walking distance to most sights. The sushi restaurant around the corner is great if you need a break from Italian. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, iffy location”
Reviews.Author: Hardiaks
Reviews.Content: The Relais le Clarisse is located in an area of Rome called the Trastevere. We chose the area because we believed it would be the most "local" in feeling. Once there, we found out it is notorious in Rome as being the most heavily littered and grafitti-ridden section of a town that suffers universally from litter and grafitti. The surrounding area was, frankly, disappointing to us upon our arrival. Having said that, we still had a good time. We were able to walk all over the city, but there is a bus that takes you into the heart of Rome which stops right near the hotel. The staff were warm, if a bit forgetful. We asked for an iron on the first day we arrived, were told it was broken but that a new one would be forthcoming the following day. It wasn't. Soon it became the ritual to return to the hotel, exchange our "bona sera"s and ask for the iron we knew would not be there. Okay, so on the plus side, we were asking for an iron in Rome. How much can you complain? In their defense, they did help us quite a bit with reservations for various activities. We enjoyed them quite a lot. The room was comfortable, but weirdly laid out. The bathroom was large enough, the shower was large, the bed was very comfortable. The room was wonderfully quiet, as well. Breakfast was very adequate, and there is a very cute little patio area onto which all the rooms open. It is an oasis for a weary traveler who might enjoy a sip of wine outside. The staff were very friendly and recommended the most delightful restaurant just a few doors down from the hotel. It was perfect! All in all, if we return to Rome, we will stay in the area just to the east of the Vatican and across the Tiber from the Vatican. It is clean, quiet, and lovely.

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Le Clarisse
HotelInfo.Address: Cardinale Merry del Val, 20, 00153 Rome, Italy
